byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Fazal Muzhary contributed reporting.

abstract: Memo from Afghanistan; Taliban representatives have been softening their hard-line stance and negotiating with factions all over Afghanistan, except for government of Pres Ashraf Ghani; talks, combined with Taliban's continued efforts to assume control of more territories, outline two-pronged effort in which insurgents are seeking to take advantage of weak government while negotiating with everyone else.
lead_paragraph: As they make battlefield gains, the insurgents are engaged in peace talks and showing signs of moving away from some of their hard-line stances.

headline.main: Taliban Are Talking Peace, Though Not With Afghan Government
headline.print_headline: Taliban Are Talking Peace, Though Not With Afghan Government

snippet: As they make battlefield gains, the insurgents are engaged in peace talks and showing signs of moving away from some of their hard-line stances.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
